solution_line_template: There are {blue_beads}+{yellow_beads}=<<{blue_beads}+{yellow_beads}={total_beads}>>{total_beads} beads in the bowl
Dividing them into {num_parts} equal parts give {total_beads}/{num_parts}=<<{total_beads}/{num_parts}={beads_per_part_initial}>>{beads_per_part_initial} beads each

Before doubling the number of beads, she had {final_beads_per_part}/{doubling_factor}=<<{final_beads_per_part}/{doubling_factor}={beads_before_doubling}>>{beads_before_doubling} beads left in each part.
Therefore she had removed {beads_per_part_initial}-{beads_before_doubling}=<<{beads_per_part_initial}-{beads_before_doubling}={beads_removed_per_part}>>{beads_removed_per_part} beads from each part.
